properties.SQL select query:
SELECT 
    t.table_schema,
    t.table_name,
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT c.column_name ORDER BY c.ordinal_position) AS columnnames,
    GROUP_CONCAT(c.data_type ORDER BY c.ordinal_position) AS types
FROM 
    information_schema.tables t
JOIN 
    information_schema.columns c 
    ON c.table_schema = t.table_schema 
    AND c.table_name = t.table_name
WHERE 
    t.table_type = 'BASE TABLE'
    AND t.table_schema = 'testdata'
    AND t.table_name = '${tablename}'
GROUP BY 
    t.table_schema, t.table_name
ORDER BY 
    t.table_schema, t.table_name;

SELECT 
    t.table_schema,
    t.table_name,
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT k.column_name ORDER BY k.ordinal_position) AS primary_key_columns,
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT c.column_name ORDER BY c.ordinal_position) AS columnnames,
    GROUP_CONCAT(DISTINCT c.data_type ORDER BY c.ordinal_position) AS types
FROM 
    information_schema.tables t
JOIN 
    information_schema.table_constraints tc 
    ON t.table_schema = tc.table_schema 
    AND t.table_name = tc.table_name 
    AND tc.constraint_type = 'PRIMARY KEY'
LEFT JOIN 
    information_schema.key_column_usage k 
    ON k.table_schema = tc.table_schema 
    AND k.table_name = tc.table_name 
    AND k.constraint_name = tc.constraint_name
JOIN 
    information_schema.columns c 
    ON c.table_schema = t.table_schema 
    AND c.table_name = t.table_name
WHERE 
    t.table_type = 'BASE TABLE'
    AND t.table_schema = 'testdata'
GROUP BY 
    t.table_schema, t.table_name
ORDER BY 
    t.table_schema, t.table_name;
